Detailed Description

Handles multiple JobCouriers in different threads.

When a job is dispatched, the dispatcher asks the scheduler (

See also:
JobScheduler) for a free courier and sends the request to it.
Once the work is done by the courier it puts itself in the reply set together with the work result.

The replies are dequeued in a reply thread and sent back to the origin, and the courier that was associated with the reply is then put back in the scheduler again. 

 *
 *   Incoming Job
 *       o
 *       |
 *       |
 *   +---v------+              +-----------+
 *   | dispatch | get runnable | scheduler |
 *   |          <--------------<           |
 *   +---v------+              +----^------+
 *       |                          |
 *       | put it to work           | add runnable
 *       o                          |
 *                                  |
 *                                  |
 *          +------------+          |
 *          |  Reply     >----------+
 *          |  Thread    | work done
 *          +------------+
 *
See also:
SingleMultiJobDispatcher

MultiJobDispatcher::MultiJobDispatcher (  PacketCache &  jobCache,
PacketSender &  sender,
ProcessorFactory &  procCreator,
uint32  nbrThreads,
JobScheduler *  scheduler,
const PacketQueue &  receiveQueue
) 
 

Create dispatcher with a set of workers.

Parameters:
jobCache Cached replies.
sender Sends replies from workers.
procCreator Creator for processors ( each worker needs one ).
nbrThreads Number of workers.
scheduler Determines which courier to take for a specific package.
receiveQueue For fetching current status of the receive queue.

Member Function Documentation

void MultiJobDispatcher::dispatch (  Packet *  packet  )  [virtual]
 

Dispatch the packet to an idle worker.

Will block until there is a free worker to take the job.
